intro: Kitamuraea koraiensis, commonly known as the Korean kitamuraa, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South Korea. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in forest understories. It is known for its delicate appearance and is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
